image.altText: Ashton Hurn looks to the right of screen in front of six microphones

props.synopsis: Only days after taking her party's top job, Liberal leader Ashton Hurn is under pressure on a key election promise.

title.children: Labor tries to end Ashton Hurn's 'honeymoon' early

image.altText: A man standing over a map and soil samples.

props.synopsis: The processing market is dominated by China, but Australia is building its capabilities in an attempt to boost the domestic industry.

title.children: First Australian rare earth processing facility under construction

image.altText: A police officer in uniform surrounded by cameras in front of dark glass doors

props.synopsis: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

title.children: Adelaide Crows appoint Police Commissioner Grant Stevens to club's board

image.altText: A photo of Chris Robertson whose death is being treated as murder.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 30-year-old man for the alleged murder of Adelaide father-of-two Chris Robertson, who was found dead in a Lonsdale workshop in September.

title.children: Police arrest man for alleged murder of father-of-two Chris Robertson

image.altText: A Public Service Association rally in Adelaide's CBD.

props.synopsis: Strike action involving prison officers has again escalated, forcing the closure of SA's major courts and causing disruptions to case hearings, which will now be rescheduled.

title.children: SA courts close amid escalating dispute over prison staff pay

image.altText: A man with grey shoulder-length hair and beard gestures with his hand, a woman withe blonde hair stands behind him

props.synopsis: Authorities say the "best signs" in a "long time" have been observed in the latest round of monitoring of the state's algal bloom crisis.

title.children: 'Best signs we've seen': SA algal testing shows positive signs ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: A midddle-aged, dark-haired man gives the thumbs up while standing before the media underneath an awning.

props.synopsis: Jeffrey Purse says a court's decision to dismiss an appeal by his son's killer offers "some justice" for his family, as the search for Michael Purse's remains continues.

title.children: Father's relief as son's murderer loses appeal against conviction

image.altText: A pair of hand hold two extra-large strawberries.

props.synopsis: Seasonal conditions are leading to big berries this summer, with the fruit on the larger side in some regions because of a wetter spring.

title.children: Supersized strawberries fill supermarket shelves

image.altText: Susan Close in a red top speaks into a microphone in front of large glass windows

props.synopsis: South Australia's former deputy premier Susan Close has called out what she describes as "extreme" socio-economic segregation in Australian schools.

title.children: Australia's education system is out of step, former SA deputy premier says

image.altText: A composite image of a middle-aged man in a suit smiling and chatting and a younger woman chatting smiling

props.synopsis: Ashton Hurn now has the job she said she didn't want. Could she be the leader the South Australian Liberal Party needs?

title.children: The political forces working for and against Ashton Hurn

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: Firefighters called to a large blaze at a house in Adelaide's north find the body of a 72-year-old woman inside.

title.children: 72yo woman dies in house fire in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A man watches out over the national parks

props.synopsis: Two outback stations 800 kilometres west of Sydney are purchased by the state government in an effort to protect the environment.

title.children: Two remote outback stations in NSW to be converted into national parks

image.altText: A person in full coveralls spraying water on the road next to a sewage tanker truck on its side

props.synopsis: The daughters of a man who died in a truck crash at the bottom of the South-Eastern Freeway in 2014 have their heavily redacted victim impact statements read aloud in court, more than 11 years after their father died.

title.children: Family of man who died in freeway crash has victim statements redacted

image.altText: Three people get in a selfie on a basketball court.

props.synopsis: The WNBA's 'StudBudz' are using live streaming to build a brand and community, while providing lessons in marketing women's sports.

title.children: 'The gays are here': How WNBA stars are revolutionising sports media

image.altText: A CFS firefighter in firefighting helmet and clothing.

props.synopsis: Peter Curtis, who died at a bushfire ground on SA's Eyre Peninsula last month, has been remembered as a loving husband, father and grandfather, and a firefighter who "led from the front" and was a "bloody good bloke to have around".

title.children: Fallen CFS firefighter remembered as 'man of great courage'

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera while holding a pen next to coloured pens on the table and other people drawing

props.synopsis: Two Adelaide women have made it their mission to collect 2,000 Christmas cards for prisoners who'll spend this year's festive season behind bars.

title.children: Christmas cards remind prisoners they are 'not forgotten' over the holidays

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, the son of Carlton Football Club great Stephen Silvagni, can now be identified as the man found guilty of rape in a trial, after a court lifted a restriction on publishing his name.

title.children: Tom Silvagni named as man from high-profile family convicted of rape

image.altText: A woman in a hooded jacket covers her face after a court appearance.

props.synopsis: A South Australian court releases audio of prison phone calls made in the lead-up to the death of a six-year-old girl in 2022. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died. Readers are also advised this story contains content which may be distressing.

title.children: Phone calls by criminally neglectful mother showed 'callous disregard' for sick daughter

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: SA Police have arrested a 31-year-old man after he allegedly sent five threatening messages on social media to a Crows player, who the ABC understands is Izak Rankine.

title.children: Arrest made after alleged threats to Crows footballer

image.altText: A moving image of a parachute getting stuck on the tail wing of a plane.

props.synopsis: Australia’s transport safety regulator has released video footage of a skydiver cutting himself free from his parachute after it became snagged on a plane wing in mid-air.

title.children: Video shows moment skydiver cuts himself free from tangled parachute

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a blue dress smiles in a venue.

props.synopsis: A high-profile British adult content creator will be banned from Bali for 10 years after police raided a "studio" on the island, in which 14 Australians were found.

title.children: Bonnie Blue to be banned from Bali after studio raid

image.altText: Profile of a woman.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former federal environment minister Tanya Plibersek have defended the Commonwealth's acceptance of the Blue Banded Bee Dreaming to protect part of a gold mine site from development.

title.children: Court hears sensitive Dreaming story led to halt of billion-dollar mine

image.altText: Man in white shirt and black tie walking

props.synopsis: Gavin Morris, the former principal of Yipirinya School in Alice Springs, has received an 18-month suspended sentence for the aggravated assault of four students.

title.children: Ex-Alice Springs principal handed suspended sentence for assaulting students

image.altText: Tourists in front of the Lincoln Memorial

props.synopsis: Australians travelling to the United States could soon face an unprecedented invasion of privacy, an international law expert has warned.

title.children: Privacy concerns over US proposing travellers reveal social media history

image.altText: Rita, left, holds onto James, right, while both smile standing in their kitchen.

props.synopsis: Bespoke architectural builds on small budgets may seem like an impossible housing dream, but James and Rita managed to turn their vision into a reality — without breaking the bank.

title.children: Rita and James built an architecturally designed house for $320k. Here's how

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Anika Wells

props.synopsis: Pressed on whether his government should review the rules that allow politicians to fly their families around the country in business class, the prime minister says his focus is on the social media ban.

title.children: PM accused of shirking responsibility on Wells controversy

image.altText: Four logs of rocky road on a cream coloured chopping board. Marshmallow, peanuts, pretzels and liquorice are visible

props.synopsis: This milk chocolate rocky road is easy to make. It creates 12 large slices, perfect for gifting or dessert if you're bringing a plate.

title.children: Easy rocky road that won't give you a sugar crash

image.altText: Olympic kayaker Alyce Wood smiles while holding her three month old daughter in her arms.

props.synopsis: The Australian Olympic Committee hopes to keep more athletes in sport by offering cash incentives for women who return after having children, and tens of thousands of dollars for retiring Olympians.

title.children: AOC offers cash incentives to keep Olympian mums in sport

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the former NRL star seek to have a civil damages lawsuit against him dismissed, citing delays in the Supreme Court civil case.

title.children: Ex-NRL star Jarryd Hayne attempts to have civil case dismissed

image.altText: A watch, ring, bracelet, police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

title.children: Four French men came to Canberra for a $10m heist, police say

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

props.synopsis: A judge says the former art shop worker had a "complete disconnect between perception and reality" as she jails him for rape.

title.children: Man jailed for 'orchestrated' rape of customer in shop where he worked

image.altText: A gas exploration site in outback scrubland.

props.synopsis: Major global oil and gas companies are expressing "serious interest" in the Beetaloo Basin for the first time, one analyst says, now that Beetaloo Energy has reached a final investment decision and committed to developing its fracking project.

title.children: Gas company clears final hurdle for fracking in the Beetaloo Basin

image.altText: A young man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses outside the local court.

props.synopsis: The NT Court of Criminal Appeal has heard an appeal against the sentence for a 24-year-old driver who avoided a jail sentence after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his vehicle, killing one, and then boasting about it over text.

title.children: 'Vile' and 'repugnant' texts sent by fatal hit-run driver at centre of appeal

image.altText: The front of a house in a street in Brookfield.

props.synopsis: A family who lived in a Melbourne home where police uncovered human remains while investigating the disappearance of a toddler say they are disturbed by the find.

title.children: Family who lived at home where human remains found 'trashed' house, sources say

image.altText: Maria Corina Machado in a black puffer jacket waving with her right hand in the air and smiling on a hotel balcony

props.synopsis: Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado, who has been living in hiding in fear for her safety, appears in public for the first time in almost a year.

title.children: Peace Prize laureate emerges from hiding to greet cheering crowds
